page.title: 01ASWARBY & SWARBY
page.content: Two small villages east and west of the Sleaford/Bourne road. Aswarby is an estate village on the east side of Aswarby Park, an area of grass and scattered trees. Daffodils are naturalised in some areas and sheep and cattle graze. Swarby has few new houses. The population of both villages are probably half land workers, the remainder commute to Sleaford or Grantham. The land is divided by thorn hedges into medium sized fields growing cereals, potatoes, sugar beet and oil seed rape. There are isolated grass fields and small woods. A daily bus service links swarby with Sleaford and Grantham. A bus also runs on the main road between Sleaford and Bourne. But without private transport villagers are somewhat isolated. The public house in square 10 serves both
